name: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione is a derivative of piperazine, which has a melting point of approximately 106°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups in the piperazine structure increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C each. However, the 1-ethyl substitution tends to lower the melting point compared to piperazine, as it creates a more asymmetric structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability. This effect might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. Summing up these changes: Piperazine base (+106°C), two carbonyl groups (+20°C), and one ethyl group (-10°C).
